title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic grabs his crotch and rows with fan on his final LA Galaxy game
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has hinted he is ready to quit LA Galaxy and return to Europe (Picture: Getty)

Zlatan Ibrahimovic was involved in a heated altercation with a fan during what could be his final LA Galaxy appearance.

The veteran striker has been tipped to make a return to European football with Napoli among the leading contenders to sign the 38-year-old.

But the former Sweden international’s MLS career ended in ignominy after he was seen making an obscene gesture, grabbing his crotch, as he made his way off the pitch following his side’s 5-3 defeat at the hands of rivals Los Angeles FC.

Zlatan has a last goodbye for a heckling LAFC fan, the Marshawn Lynch memorial crotch grab pic.twitter.com/2Z1Y2aSbsw — CJ Fogler (@cjzero) October 25, 2019

‘They said something. [I’m] not being disrespectful, but this is like training for me,” Ibrahimovic said of the incident.

‘The stadium is too small for me. This is a walk in the park.

‘If I stay it will be good for MLS because the whole world will watch it.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic scored twice but couldn’t prevent LA Galaxy from losing against Los Angeles FC (Picture: Getty)

‘If I don’t stay, nobody will remember what MLS is.’

The ex-Manchester Untied, Juventus and Barcelona star’s contract with the club is set to expire in the coming months and, despite ending the season with 31 goals, is unlikely to sign a new deal amid speculation he could, ultimately retire.

‘Could be,’ he said last week when asked if El Trafico could represent the last game of his illustrious career.

‘There are no other thoughts, I respect my contract. If I leave you will have less to write about.

‘If I stay you will still have something to write about. Let’s see what happens. But let’s focus on the play-off. I think [my future] is not the right thing to discuss.

‘I’ve had a good time, good experience. I’ve learned a lot on how it works here, still a work in progress’
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic was involved in a heated altercation with a fan during what could be his final LA Galaxy appearance. The veteran striker has been tipped to make a return...
